column5: I'm planning on doing a little trolling before the season ends, I have this huge rod that a friend bought and never used. Its an 8 ft MH shimano rod and I've paired it with a size 30 rapala reel .  It just seems way to big? I am going to be using big lures though...  I am not looking for the perfect setup, just wondrnig if I can get by with it?
To big?  It might be to small  I love my 8' Heavy action Compre..  Works perfectly.
I have a 7'6 MH compre that I use for every situation and love it.
Perfect rod! Rod makers are finally moving to longer rods and away from the short pool cues!
ya sure it'll work but hey i like smaller lighter action rods, adds that extra thrill when hooking into a big one

Not too big at all .. one of my favourite rods of all time was a 9' fenwick rigger stick .. which I used for Salmon, Musky, Trout ... you name it ... it had backbone for 30lb test and yet was supple enough to handle 12 lb test too  For my money a longer rod for trolling is better suited (big quarry) and allows you to work a fish around things - especially in a bigger boat
